website_summaries.verdict: This fleece draft stopper is lightweight and won't be a good fit for all doors; measure carefully first.
pros: Synthetic fleece draft stopper filled with nylon fiber
Weighted with cotton bags and ground stone
Handle makes it easy to hang when not in use
cons: May not fully cover a 36-inch doorway, as the handle is included in the measurement

customer_reviews.title: It does not stay snugged up against a door like most of the draft protectors do
customer_reviews.text: This product is not what it presents itself to be. If you want a heavy, weighted 36 inch draft protector, do not buy this. The actual length is 34 inches with a tab at the end which adds the additional 2 inches. This product is lightweight with the fiberfill and has 3 small areas with a few tiny gravels in it. It does not stay snugged up against a door like most of the draft protectors do. I will be sending this back for a refund asap. Very disappointed. : (
customer_reviews.author: donna l. harbison

customer_reviews.title: This product is so-so at best. The overall length must include the little rope ...
customer_reviews.text: This product is so-so at best. The overall length must include the little rope handle because it is NOT wide enough to cover my 36 inch door. (Its about 4-5 inches short and therefore not fully functional) The construction of the product is average at best and it's stiff enough that it rolls away from the door and only partially blocks the draft. We have to push an area rug up against it so it blocks any draft. Overall opinion: Disappointing product, disappointing functionality, quality of materials is average.
customer_reviews.author: Chris G.

customer_reviews.title: Make your own at home.
customer_reviews.text: It's almost entirely cheap stuffing. Does not conform to the shape of the gap in the door and tons of air still gets in. I cut a whole in the top, removed the stuffing, and filled it with rice. I could have constructed a far better version of this in less than an hour out of an old shirt. If you have one extra hour, the ability to sew a straight line, and own some rice don't waste your money on this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Amber H.

customer_reviews.title: Packaging ruined it.
customer_reviews.text: The item came folded into thirds. After I opened it, the draft stopper was creased and won’t sit flush against the door making it ineffective.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Attractive and helpful
customer_reviews.text: I like it a lot. The only problem, for us, is that it isn’t quite long enough to completely cover the area in front of our screen door. There is a sizeable gap there because the weather stripping has worn off and we had hoped to completely fill in that gap with the draft stopper because we like to keep the main door open when the weather is nice. Since it is close to filling in the area, we will probably add a little more stuffing to stretch it out a little more. It is a nice draft stopper and is as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: T. Olsen

customer_reviews.title: Too light.  Doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: I dislike how light it is. There's probably 3 T of beans in it on three different pockets. I'm going to have to open one end and fill it with rice to make it work. It's so light weight that it won't stay up next to the door. Worthless as it is at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Kole

customer_reviews.title: Good dog toy
customer_reviews.text: This is not even 33” and so lightweight my dog picked it up thinking it was a toy for him
customer_reviews.author: David McWaters

customer_reviews.title: Good crawlie blocker.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this primarily to keep crawlies out of my house. Blocked the bottom of the security door, where they are most likely to enter. I am not willing to share my home with anything with more than four legs, and after finding a black widow in the front bedroom, Thank God I don't live in San Bernardino or Riverside counties, or in Pomona, where it is common to find them inside the houses, and people have to check their beds before getting in at night. Oh, no, no, no. I had to do more to keep them out. This seems to be working so far. Well made product.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Works okay, but not heavy enough to fully cover
customer_reviews.text: Product is well made and convenient to pick up and move or put down in front of the door crack. The only problem is that the snake (for lack of a better term, the long plush tube) has weights in it to make it stay in place, but the weights are small enough and placed far enough apart that the snake does not lie smoothly - it buckles up in between the weights. So it doesn't make a consistent seal and some draught can sneak through. Still worth it for fair price and easy use.
customer_reviews.author: Kman618

customer_reviews.title: Thickly Filled
customer_reviews.text: This door stopper was quite satisfactory. With all draft stoppers, I am concerned that they are not adequately filled (thick enough) to stop the drafts under the door. This draft stopper had adequate filling and was the proper length to stop the draft under my door. The loop at the end makes for easy hanging when not in use. I would recommend this purchase. The beige is a neutral color.
customer_reviews.author: RebC

customer_reviews.title: Not really happy
customer_reviews.text: While it is the least expensive product of its type, it is not very flexible or form fitting. I have two different door each with a bit of a raised threshold. The weather stop is not very flexible and does not allow itself to be forced up to the bottom door. It takes a lot of effort to really get this thing to seal the door. I have had to add a towel to augment the benefit. I am considering sending this back.
customer_reviews.author: Baldybayer

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to see if I could block some of the air coming in under my entry door. It works well and I shall continue using it when our weather turns hot again as I'm sure it will be helpful then in keeping the hot air out.
customer_reviews.author: Susann E. DeViney

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind from the great outdoors.
customer_reviews.text: I got three of these, one for each door that leads to the outside. It keeps out the cold, heat, little creepy crawlers, and noise. I haven’t washed it yet, but it is washable.
customer_reviews.author: ibot-two-tiny-end-tables

customer_reviews.title: Kinda flimsy
customer_reviews.text: This is way lighter than I was anticipating. Only has the heavy beads on the ends so I don't feel like it stays snug against the door, which was the entire point. Doesn't do a very good job of sealing the crack if it isn't snug. Also, make sure you know how wide your door is. I took for granted that most doors used for apartment buildings would be a fairly common/uniform size, and that products such as these would pretty much that basic size. I was wrong and this product was too short to fit across the door. So don't be like me and measure your door.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use - and stops the draft!!! Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: It isn't always cold in my town, but when it is it blows it's way in under my older double front doors. A fix is down the road, but meanwhile these saved my feet, my kitty's feet and my electric bill. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Lea

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: I honestly wish I hadn’t bought this and had just bought something that attached to my door. This doesn’t cover anything, and to have to move it to my door every time , is stupid. It’s just worthless, honestly
customer_reviews.author: Tanya F

customer_reviews.title: Awesome draft stopper!
customer_reviews.text: I use this to block sound/ draft under my son’s bedroom door. It works like a charm! The length is longer than the width of the door but I simply curve it up on both ends to fit it in the doorway which seems to make it work even better. It stays in place perfectly. I highly recommend this for any door width.
customer_reviews.author: AJ Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Very well made.
customer_reviews.text: I like this a lot and I would have given 5 stars, I just had trouble getting this to stay put in the opening in the door we were using it for. Very well made, good fabric, good weight. I would recommend it...I just needed a super snug fit and I have had decent luck with it.
customer_reviews.author: JS in MA

customer_reviews.title: Makes a difference
customer_reviews.text: This definitely makes a difference in the winter time blocking the draft from the front door. It fits just about perfectly and is weighted enough to stay put (but makes it hard to open the door from the other side when its on carpet). The hanging handle on the end is super convenient too.
customer_reviews.author: amanda b

customer_reviews.title: Easy to maneuver
customer_reviews.text: This product is perfect. It hangs on the door handle ready to be placed. Placing it is so easy as it bends and fits perfectly. It is neutral in color, so blends with any décor. I use it to keep the bugs out when I open the patio door by placing it at the bottom of the door. It easily covers a slight gap. I plan to use it with the door closed to keep the cold draft out this winter.
customer_reviews.author: viv

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: When I mark 3 for light weight, it is a compliment. It is not so heavy that it is hard to use. The good weight that is is makes it easy to conform to my door. Because it is the weight it is, I can push it close to the door and cover the space under the door.
customer_reviews.author: ruffles

customer_reviews.title: great quality
customer_reviews.text: I really like the quality and the color of this weather stop. I wanted something that I can easily put under the door at night and then hide or put away in the morning, and this product has a nice handle that I can use to hang it nearby. it's inexpensive and it has a great quality. I would highly recommend this stopper.
customer_reviews.author: Mariana

customer_reviews.title: Different than photo
customer_reviews.text: I received this today. It had a paper label on it but it also had some sort of plastic wrap around it, maybe to make it smaller in the shipping box? It was strange. Made it look sorta used. It also is sewn strangely. Its thinner in the center and wide at the ends. I’m still keeping it because it’s not worth a return but it definitely doesn’t look as nice as the photo. Does the job - keeps out the drafts.
customer_reviews.author: BecsTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter 3 years ago to use in a bedroom that has a door to the attic and in the Winter the cold air comes in and makes the room very cold. Bought the Home Intuition Door draft stopper and it has made a significant difference in the room. I now have purchased one for myself for a door that has a space that is allowing plenty if cold air in and know it will be a big help.
customer_reviews.author: Kari S.

customer_reviews.title: Does the job.
customer_reviews.text: This is a lightweight draft buster that use at our kitchen door to block cold air in the winter. It has a handy loop for hanging when not in use. We could also use this to block drafts on window ledges. These are a must in old, drafty homes.
customer_reviews.author: frisky2000

customer_reviews.title: i think this does a good job of blocking air from escaping
customer_reviews.text: in my workplace, i sit right in front of a window. there isn't much heat that goes towards me. i bought this in hopes of making my workplace warmer, but as it turns out, there is also cold air literally blowing on me from the ceiling. anyway, i think this does a good job of blocking air from escaping, but i can't certifiably say for certain.
customer_reviews.author: K. Keenan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect product for our unique needs!
customer_reviews.text: Just what we wanted--not as a draft stopper, but as way to block the back of our sofa against the wall in our RV. It stopped hats and other assorted items from falling down the back. Perfect solution! We bought a 3rd one so that our automatic vacuum wouldn't tumble down the stairs on it's nightly journey. That also worked wonderfully.
customer_reviews.author: Stan L. Riggin

customer_reviews.title: Get the up-grade
customer_reviews.text: I found this model to be extremely light-weight and flimsy. Comparing it to another model I purchased, it’s not worth trying to save a buck! Spend a little more and get a better quality draft stopper.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela P. Smith

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I use it on the double doors leading to the master bedroom. I open the window a bit at night to cool the room down, but I don't want to cool down the rest of the house, so the weather stops do a great job of keeping the cool in one room. I love the way they look and feel and I love the loop on the end. I hang them up each morning on a "Command Hook" so they're out of the way.
customer_reviews.author: Elgie

customer_reviews.title: Too Light
customer_reviews.text: Has no weight to it, just rolls away from the door no matter how I situate it.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Monroe

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: It is an excellent product. Its thick and seals well the gap under a door. I have used it for a 24 inch wide door and 31.5 inch wide door. It falls just short of 36 inch wide door both in height and width and I may have to look for other options.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: light weight
customer_reviews.text: what l really like about this weather stop is how well it fits in the door jam of my sliding door, it really keeps the cold air out and l love how light it is. thank you so much. l will be ordering another one
customer_reviews.author: cm

customer_reviews.title: Good quality door stopper
customer_reviews.text: We purchased a century old home...it came with some significant gaps in doors. This draftstopper was a perfect fit in both length and color. It feels like its filled with a heavy polyester. No smell. Will buy a second for back door.
customer_reviews.author: sbarna411

customer_reviews.title: Gecko Problem Resolved
customer_reviews.text: We have a major problem with geckos getting onto our back patio and front porch. We have basically been overcharged to have new door sweeps replaced and there is still space under the doors where these critters can get in. I'm so tired of looking at and cleaning up gecko poop. Then this idea came to me to try the draft dodger and see if that less-expensive solution would work, and it does!! I wasn't sure if it would work because I thought it needed more weight. Thanks for a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mom says they work great
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my mom. She has a large sliding door which leaks cold air in winter. I got her three of them and it works. What I loved about them is they can hang in the closet when no in use.
customer_reviews.author: JEM

customer_reviews.title: Warning: featherweight and non-durable
customer_reviews.text: There is no weight to this to keep it lying down in a secure position. The fabric is very soft and non-durable, and looks like it would get very dirty very easily. It’s more of a slim pillow than a weighted door draft stopper. I am returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Mojave Narrows

customer_reviews.title: works wonderfully
customer_reviews.text: This fits perfect in front of my door. I live in a senior apartment and sometimes the odors from other apartments seep into mine. I used a rolled up rug, but this is the perfect fit. I has enough weight to hold it in place and the self attached handle is perfect to hang over the doorknob when I go out.
customer_reviews.author: mtc

customer_reviews.title: Know the width of your door
customer_reviews.text: I have a standard 36 inch width door, however this product is about 32 inches but can be stretched to almost 36 inches. Also, the design and shape of the product does not snug up very well to the door, thus allowing cold air to get through.
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie Lee Dickerson

customer_reviews.title: too light weight
customer_reviews.text: Product is constructed well however it needs at least twice as much weight inside for it to lay flat and snug against the crack of the door. Option could be for the producer to add a zipper with a liner and ship only the material. With it empty this would cost less for shipping. Include directions for customer fill with play sand purchased at local hardware store. This would make the product more effective for the customer and cheaper for the producer in shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Steven C. McKain

customer_reviews.title: NOT 36” It’s 34” so measure your door!
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made item but it is NOT 36”. Therefore it does not prevent a draft across a main door. It’s 34” and leaves a gap for cold air.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy R

customer_reviews.title: More than just a draft stop!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband to put along the bottom of the bedroom door to keep the light out. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: J. Bean

customer_reviews.title: Not a favorite.
customer_reviews.text: I dislike the fact that I have a 3 foot door but not a 3 foot draft blocker, also it doesn't stay against the door so the cold air still comes in. I should have read the other reviews, not happy.
customer_reviews.author: Larry W.

customer_reviews.title: Leaves a gap at both ends if the door isn't wide enough
customer_reviews.text: Not flexible enough and doesn't tuck under well at left and right sides of the door, hence it leaves gaps if the door isn't exactly the same size.
customer_reviews.author: Brian J. Starr

customer_reviews.title: Good product -- works as it should
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product, which works as it should. I bought it to stop the draft at the bottom of a door, and it helps a lot. I had been stuffing an old towel there, but this works much better. The draft was so bad that when our lawn service used a leaf blower near that door, we would find dirt and leaves inside the house. This draft stopper helped with that.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice but length is too short for a door
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to avoid the house from wind blowing under our door. This one does not help as it is missing 3 inches to really cover the door length (standard for size). Otherwise it looks very nice. Just way too short.
customer_reviews.author: jannet9

customer_reviews.title: Pretty happy overall.
customer_reviews.text: The product was pretty much what I expected. It seems to be doing a pretty good job of reducing the drafts we had coming under the doors of our 1928 home. They seem to view it being "light weight" as a positive selling point. Personally, I'd have preferred if it was a bit more dense and heavy. But that's a small thing. For the money I am very satisfied with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Stock

customer_reviews.title: Does the job well
customer_reviews.text: This has really helped keep the draft away. We have an old home that has settled and the other door product we tried did not use . This also has a small hook so you can hang it when not in use .
customer_reviews.author: courtney cotton

customer_reviews.title: Stops drafts well
customer_reviews.text: This works well to stop drafts from under the door and the neutral color helps it blend in and stay clean looking despite swiping over the floor constantly. This one is a medium weight and won't stop every bit of air, but it blocks most of it. I'd buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Hoobie

customer_reviews.title: Not a 3 foot draft stop.
customer_reviews.text: My biggest disappointment is the actual length of the item against the door. I do not consider the loop handle to be part of the functional part of the item.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Eh
customer_reviews.text: I can’t say this really works on the sound end, but definitely works for keeping out a draft. Mine came unevenly stuffed, it had way more stuffing on the ends than in the middle, making it kinda hard to fit under my door with a large gap.
customer_reviews.author: Qunming

customer_reviews.title: Not very well made
customer_reviews.text: My item is hard in spots and is not very flexible to fill in my gaps also the material is thin and I’m afraid to put pressure on it for fear it will burst Not much value for the price I’ve found cheaper and better quality
customer_reviews.author: PITMAN

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: This is just what we need for our apartment door. It’s a little short for out door. We needed something lightweight. As a caution, the length includes the handle.
customer_reviews.author: David Brownstein

customer_reviews.title: This doesn't work as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: This does not work. Its not shape conforming enough to stop a door draft. And its too light weight. We may replace the filling with coarse, clean sand or pebbles.
customer_reviews.author: Code Monkey

customer_reviews.title: the quality
customer_reviews.text: using to block out noise and drafts from adjacent rooms. Also making a/c run time less when ducts in rooms not occupied are closed down
customer_reviews.author: yellow rimshot

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Much flimsier and lightweight than I expected. Since it's so lightweight, it really doesn't press up against the door to block the cold from coming in.
customer_reviews.author: disneylover4

customer_reviews.title: Worked to block drafty windows.
customer_reviews.text: I laid two of these on ledge under double windows. They worked perfectly to block air from coming in.
customer_reviews.author: Thrift shopper 41

customer_reviews.title: Works just fine for me
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why this got such bad reviews, works fine for my average sized door, not too short. Just heavy enough to stay in place unless you have tornadic winds coming in from under your door. Nice run of the mill draft stop.
customer_reviews.author: Laura P.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect- keeps the cold out
customer_reviews.text: It really keeps the cold out- i use it at my front door & the hallway is no longer freezing
customer_reviews.author: Angelina

customer_reviews.title: This thing was a must during our winter. Our ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing was a must during our winter. Our garage door has a huge gap between the door and the floor, and this thing was exactly what we needed to seal the heat from escaping the house and now have draft in the house.
customer_reviews.author: Lily Peterson

customer_reviews.title: We use this for our fireplace
customer_reviews.text: This product keeps the draftiness away from our room by snuggling up to our fireplace. We put two on top of each other to fit our screen vents.
customer_reviews.author: B. J. Crawford

customer_reviews.title: perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: does exactly what it's designed to do. it stops cold air drafts! i had a pretty significant gap between my door and the threshold. cold air rolling in. once i put this in place, no more drafts. good quality, good value
customer_reviews.author: John Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't stay against door gap
customer_reviews.text: I like the way it looks. But it doesn't easily stay up against the door to block the draft. I wish it was more round with more beads in it to weight it down. Since it is more flat, it tips away from the door. Looks good, but doesn't do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money unfortunately
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't block anything. It doesn't even fit snug to the floor and I could feel air going underneath it. Waste of money unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too lightweight
customer_reviews.text: It only has beans/beads in a small section of each end..it is WAY too light weight..a rolled up towel can do just as good of a job..very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: it works!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered it as we have a serious draft coming from our basement..the draft stopper works perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: peace w. baxter

customer_reviews.title: He's a Drummer Blocks some of sound under Door
customer_reviews.text: What a good thing not just for draft's work's for blocking sound to
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Griffith

customer_reviews.title: Love the fabric
customer_reviews.text: This is the second draft dodger I have purchased. It's long enough to fit inside one half of my glass doors along the track and really helps keep the cold wind out. Love the fabric. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Helen Towles

customer_reviews.title: It's okay
customer_reviews.text: It's not incredible (look wise or quality) but it does the trick. I like that it has the rope to hang on door knob when not using.
customer_reviews.author: geewiz

customer_reviews.title: Incorrect length!
customer_reviews.text: This was advertised as a 36” draft stopper for a 36” door. It is actually 34” which leaves 2” exposed where drafts will continue Not good. Needs to be 36” as described. Would love to have them send me on that is 36” as described.
customer_reviews.author: William G Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Great idea
customer_reviews.text: I am using these to keep my German Shepherds toys from going under the couch where we can't reach them. They are perfect for this!
customer_reviews.author: Pat Linn

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and draft free.
customer_reviews.text: Draft from slider to deck in dining room. Good protection!
customer_reviews.author: P. Hackworth

customer_reviews.title: Not thick or heavy for our draft
customer_reviews.text: Not good quality. Was not completely full of beans only two small areas on each end. Does not fit entire length of door. Feels like it’s just fleece and thin stuffing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does what it was made for.
customer_reviews.text: A great stopper of air coming under my front door...
customer_reviews.author: BRAD STEPHENS

customer_reviews.title: Short Stopper
customer_reviews.text: This draft stopper's material only measures 34". there is a 2" loop on one side. That accounts for the total 36". Not sufficient to block a 36" exterior door opening.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence R.

customer_reviews.title: Nice product.
customer_reviews.text: Bought to use in our RV between the kitchen and garage door. A little long for this door bit that is expected due to smaller doors in RV’s. Works as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Polly

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: It prevent lightning from coming thru bottom of door if I can keep my Yorkie from it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too lightweight
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had one that’s much heavier and this is too light ... should be heavyweight because it’s SUPPOSED TO STOP DRAFTS!
customer_reviews.author: Diana2dogs Painter

customer_reviews.title: Look durable
customer_reviews.text: I will give this to my brother as a gift.
customer_reviews.author: Hopper

customer_reviews.title: High quality - no air leaks
customer_reviews.text: Heavier than I expected (that's a good thing). Seals well at the bottom of my front door - no air leaks. Well made. Exactly what I was looking for. High quality materials. Much better than I had expected for the low price.
customer_reviews.author: Lucky Guy

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly Especially like the loop to hang on the door handle when opening the door ! Genius!!
customer_reviews.author: DEBORAH L BAILEY

customer_reviews.title: Rated it only two stars because it is short of ...
customer_reviews.text: Rated it only two stars because it is short of the advertised length of 36 inches, and it is not heavy enough to stay in place at a sliding door. It rolls off the oak saddle and away from the door. Had to improvise to keep it in place.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Great fit.
customer_reviews.text: These are a great fit for my 36 inch doors.
customer_reviews.author: MEH

customer_reviews.title: This seems to make a difference in the warmth of the room!
customer_reviews.text: I like the loop on the end which allows you to hang the draft stopper over the doorknob when not in use, or when you want to open the door.
customer_reviews.author: Mary B.

customer_reviews.title: Stops the drafts!
customer_reviews.text: I lived in Las Vegas and my apartment building was a little old so the doors didn't seal properly. However, this little baby worked excellently!
customer_reviews.author: BkDiva

customer_reviews.title: Not what is advertised.
customer_reviews.text: This is not 36 inches it is 33 inches which leaves a gap on both ends. It also rolls away from the door. Not very well made.
customer_reviews.author: iris rodak

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic buy for the price
customer_reviews.text: Using this product to help keep in the cool air in my apartment from the air conditioner. Works great. Would recommend to anyone else.
customer_reviews.author: Prayformercy

customer_reviews.title: It isn't weighted enough to stay tight to the door to minimize the draft.
customer_reviews.text: This is too light weight so it isn't able to stay tight against the door. It has 3 weighted points, 1 at each end and one in the middle, but it isn't heavy or weighted enough to hold it into place next to the base of the door to minimize the draft. Unfortunately, I cannot recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: K. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Not very heavy
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty lightweight. It slides around if not wedged at the bottom of an interior door. Would prefer a weightier draft roll.
customer_reviews.author: Nicki

customer_reviews.title: The draft stopper works but is the length includes the end loop
customer_reviews.text: The draft stopper is 36" including the loop on the end; the actual draft stopping portion measures only 34.5". It does work well, is light weight and seems like it will hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Jhamberg

customer_reviews.title: Very nice but try different materials
customer_reviews.text: Great color, good size. Would like to find one a little larger around, difficult to find. The material is nice, however something that doesn't collect hair and debris as easily would be nicer
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Hawk

customer_reviews.title: Came damaged
customer_reviews.text: We are using it to keep little buggies out of our apartment. It’s nice and does the job but it did come with a hole in it. I didn’t feel like returning it because I can easily sew it but still
customer_reviews.author: ARBR

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it if your trying to block drafts.
customer_reviews.text: As a door blocker/stopper doesn't work. My dog likes it tho. She pulls it around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Wroblewski

customer_reviews.title: draft stopper
customer_reviews.text: like it very much does what I need it for
customer_reviews.author: lynnghms

customer_reviews.title: Keep heat in house
customer_reviews.text: Need these to fill small gap in basement doors saving heat in house
customer_reviews.author: Julie Ward

customer_reviews.title: pretty color but gets dirty easily
customer_reviews.text: it was long & wide enough to get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Marques

customer_reviews.title: DRAFTS NO MORE
customer_reviews.text: I have been using my draft stoppers at the sliding doors from my breakfast room to the deck and my room is so much warmer than before I started using my two "HOME INTUITION 3-FEET DRAFT STOPPER CLOYJ SEAL WEATHER STOP, BEIGE. I would recommend them to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Pawnee

customer_reviews.title: Wish I could be more positive
customer_reviews.text: This draft blocker has only 3 bean (stone) pockets. On the ends and in the middle. Thus does not really give you a tight seal across the doorway threshold. Might be better with more bean pockets or even a rigid piece of metal across the length of the blocker.
customer_reviews.author: Spiderman_Jack

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last too long, my dogs thought they were ...
customer_reviews.text: Didn't last too long,my dogs thought they were toys and ripped them up!
customer_reviews.author: charlie pella

customer_reviews.title: Does a good job
customer_reviews.text: Does the job. Keeps cold air outside by back door. Plenty wide enough.
customer_reviews.author: TK

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I love that it is weighted on the underside on both ends and middle.
customer_reviews.author: katherine fuller

product_meta.title: Home Intuition 3-Feet Draft Stopper Cloth Seal Weather Stop, Beige
feature_bullets: STOP COLD DRAFTS- Our weatherstripping cloth helps you put an end to cold air drafts that sneak through the bottom gap of your home doors. With a 35 inch long design and a 3 inch diameter, you can place them on any windows, sliding or glass doors.

MADE TO BLOCK DRAFTS-The exterior fabric is made of tightly woven synthetic fleece while inside we use a nylon fiber fill- a full, draft-stopping combo. Plus, our underdoor insulator is weighted with cotton bags filled with ground stone so that it always stays securely in place
MULTIFUNCTIONAL- Besides heat insulation, our cold air blocker strip can help you with dampening outside noise for a better sleep, as well as reduce smells and light slipping through the bottom gap.
SAVE ON BILLS, ALL YEAR LONG- Make your home more energy efficient by retaining heat during the winter and making the most out of each minute your AC is on during the summer.
FITS IN ANY DÉCOR- Enjoy a neutral beige color for your weather stop that can fit into any backdrop without ever looking out of place.
